page.title: 18Norman church
page.content: At the extreme end of this block we find the small parish church of Acton Beauchamp. This is a plain, yet attractive building which has been used for worship for about 800 years. Evidence of its age can be seen in the very old tombstones which have crumbled away to be almost unrecognis- able. Services are held there twice every month. The church is part of a large parish with five churches; the others being Bishops Frome, Castle Frome, Evesbatch, and Fromes Hill.Only one farm house is near the church and there are very few houses within a mile. Most parishioners from Munderfield, the west side of the block, would attend Bishops Frome church which is the central church with a resident vicar. The church of Avenbury which is just outside the area is now a ruin.
